definition: cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
to roll (up)/to sweep up/to carry on/roll

sentences.english: He spat at the lonely cigarette, misty smoke wind.
sentences.chinese: 他吐着寂寞的烟卷，飘渺的烟雾随风而散。

sentences.english: He averages one pack of cigarettes a day.
sentences.chinese: 他均匀每日抽一包烟卷儿。

sentences.english: Ce: can you do me one of your Bolshevik roll-ups?
sentences.chinese: 能给我一支你的土烟卷吗？

sentences.english: Ce: can you do me one of your Bolshevik roll-ups? beautiful day.
sentences.chinese: 能给我一支你的土烟卷吗？天气真好。

sentences.english: As soon as he produced a packet of cigarettes he would pass it around.
sentences.chinese: 他的烟卷盒儿，只要一掏出来，便绕着圈儿递给大家。

sentences.english: Pike was puffing away at a cigarette nervously.
sentences.chinese: 派克紧张不安地一口接一口抽着烟卷。

sentences.english: He smoked Prince Albert tobacco in cigarettes he rolled himself.
sentences.chinese: 他自己曾把阿尔伯特王子牌的烟草卷成烟卷儿吸。

sentences.english: The wind curled the smoke in fanciful whorls.
sentences.chinese: 风把烟卷成一个个奇怪的旋涡。

sentences.english: Yunshu cigarette test arms, was the message the next month before the wind.
sentences.chinese: 云舒烟卷试怀抱，月下风前得消息。

sentences.english: The two men were all holding cigarette in their mouths, then came the fifth sound of "snap".
sentences.chinese: 两人嘴里都叼着烟卷，随即响起了第五次“咔嚓”声。

sentences.english: The cigarette fell out of my lips.
sentences.chinese: 烟卷从我的嘴里掉了下来。

sentences.english: But of the roughly one in two Chinese men who smoke, the vast majority choose cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 但中国大约一半的抽烟男士中，大多数选择烟卷。

definition: cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
to swallow clouds and blow out fog (idiom)/to blow cigarette or opium smoke
